intro: Greeniopsis discolor, commonly known as the variegated greeniopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking variegated leaves, which display shades of green and white. It produces small, pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Greeniopsis discolor is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
